navigationContext.accessibilityText: Open article: Introducing Code Llama, a state-of-the-art large language model for coding by meta.careers

title.text: Introducing Code Llama, a state-of-the-art large language model for coding

text.text:
Teams at Meta are building innovative technologies that have the capacity to positively impact people’s lives. We’re excited to introduce Code Llama — a large language model (LLM) built on top of Llama 2 that uses text prompts to generate code. In addition to its potential to help make workflows more efficient for developers and empower programmers to write more robust software, Code Llama may also be used as a tool to help people who are learning to code.


Code Llama is free for both research and commercial use. Learn more on the Meta AI blog: https://lnkd.in/gcZgNJDv

text.text:
In April, WhatsApp launched key transparency, a new cryptographic security feature to automatically verify a secured connection. Now, meet some of the team members that built and scaled the feature to billions of people.

Meta Tech Podcast host Pascal H. is joined by Sean L., a purveyor of privacy on the server privacy team, and Kevin L., a research scientist on the applied privacy tech team. In episode 54, these metamates dive deep into the origin story of key transparency, how it enables automatic verification and how it successfully combats cyberattacks.

Listen here:
Spotify: https://meta.careers/mtps 
iTunes: https://meta.careers/mtpi 
Google Podcasts: https://meta.careers/mtpg 

#MetaTechPodcast

navigationContext.accessibilityText: Open article: Reality Labs' Display Systems Research to Present New Demos at SIGGRAPH 2023 | Meta Quest Blog by meta.com

title.text: Reality Labs' Display Systems Research to Present New Demos at SIGGRAPH 2023 | Meta Quest Blog

text.text:
The Display Systems Research team at Reality Labs Research has lifted the VR curtain with two new demo prototypes: Butterscotch Varifocal and Flamera. Both prototypes are still in the research stage — and that’s the point. 

The team’s mantra is “demo or die,” using demos to investigate the “why” of a technical challenge. Here, they dive deep into how these technologies are pushing the VR industry forward, from improving visual comfort to advancing mixed reality: meta.careers/3OMZ7KH 

#RealityLabs #Metaverse #VR #SIGGRAPH #ButterscotchVarifocal #Flamera

images.accessibilityText: graphical user interface, application

text.text:
Congratulations to the teams at Meta who worked on the release of Llama 2!

Llama 2 is the next generation of our open source large language model available for free for research and commercial use. Increasing access to models like this can create a new era of economic and social opportunities for startups, entrepreneurs and researchers. 

We believe an open approach is the right one for the development of today's AI models.

More information on the Llama 2 model, and what this means for people building Generative AI products: https://ai.meta.com/llama/      

#Llama2 #LLM #GenAI

text.text: When the war in Ukraine started, Asmara H. saw students struggling to leave and find safety, so she decided to help. With her community’s support, 450 students were evacuated to Germany—Asmara and volunteers were then able to maintain communication with the students via WhatsApp. From accommodations, to toiletries, to helping register for new classes, she’s made sure the students feel supported and cared for as they rebuild in a brand new country.

text.text:
“When I moved from Bangalore to Gurgaon to start my new role at Meta, the world went into lockdown. I was grappling with a lot of change, but the culture and sense of community at Meta showed up for me every day. Right from the start, my teammates reached out to ask me not only about work, but how I was settling in and navigating the new city. They showed, and still show, so much care in the moments that matter most.” — Bipasha C.

Learn more about how we are building Meta in India: https://lnkd.in/gYdBrySA

text.text:
Connectivity is vital to our shared future. But even in a metropolis as renowned as New York City, trenching new fiber cables can be difficult and costly—so internet access remains uneven.

Developed by Meta, Terragraph is a wireless internet solution that provides affordable, reliable broadband over the air—at gigabit speeds. The technology is already being successfully deployed by Silicon Harlem, Flume, and Sky Packets in communities from Harlem to Brooklyn, and beyond. Open-source and easy to install, Terragraph is available now to OEMs and ISPs across the world in partnership with The Linux Foundation. For more information, visit https://lnkd.in/eW-dvbj.

text.text: “I have dyslexia and autism. It’s something that’s not obvious to others, but it’s significantly important,” shares Andrew S., a manager on the Workplace team at Meta. “Our head of diversity and inclusion always asks, ‘How are we going to build products for everyone if we don’t have representation from everyone?’ This includes autistic people. At Meta, we’re focused on representation and building products to serve all of the people who use our products and services. That’s really important to me.” https://lnkd.in/eeeez5Aq #LifeAtMeta #AutismAcceptanceMonth

text.text: After a difficult diagnosis, Dave S. turned fear into hope by sharing his poetry on Facebook as The Blind Poet. Dave has Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), a rare genetic disease that causes severe and permanent sight loss over time. When Dave lost his job and his home, he transformed his struggles into words and advocacy for the blind. He’s written hundreds of poems that help others relate and understand the experiences of the blind community. Experience Dave's story in his own words.

text.text:
“The future of Meta in India calls for two key superpowers. The first is developers who understand how people want to interact with the immersive world around them. Second, the metaverse is opening up a global marketplace. Our endeavor as a platform is to take what is developed by the unique, innovative companies and people in India and bring it to the world.” — Manish C., Director and Head of Partnerships, Meta

Learn more about how we are building Meta in India: https://lnkd.in/eirGBbDN

text.text: Martin N. understands what it means to be lonely. After sharing his thoughts on Facebook, he realized others needed an outlet too. He founded the Group, Tales of Nigerians, to give people a safe space to  share their life experiences, connect, and learn about mental health and emotional intelligence. Now, over 80,000 members tell their stories and feel seen.

text.text:
“There are now more than 15 million businesses, both small and large, using the WhatsApp business app across India. I’m so proud of how we empower these businesses to create a digital avatar of their offline retail solutions, helping them connect consumers, businesses and communities—and this is just the tip of the iceberg of what’s possible. Messaging commerce is here to stay, and we’re very excited about what it means for us going forward.” — Prateek S.

Learn more about how we are building Meta in India: https://lnkd.in/ddbnAhJD

text.text: Ashley M. created a community movement of giving and kindness to honor widows on Valentine’s Day through flowers. After founding the nonprofit, Valentine's Day Widow Outreach Project, Ashley went suddenly blind in one eye. Instagram helped to mobilize volunteer efforts for Valentine’s Day—and ultimately connected her to the widows she sought to support—during some of her hardest moments.

Every day, we see more and more people come to Meta to build their businesses and communities and connect meaningfully with each other.” — Niharika P., Head of Creative, Curation and Programs, Meta
